Class GuiController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.view.GuiController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class GuiController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
The View Controller in the MVC architecture.

This class handles the JavaFX UI updates, captures user input, and manages the game loop (Timeline). It delegates complex rendering logic to BoardRenderer and forwards game events to the GameController.

  • Constructor Details

    • GuiController

      public GuiController()
      Default constructor.

      Called by the FXMLLoader when the view is loaded.

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      public void initialize(URL location, ResourceBundle resources)
      Initializes the controller class.

      Sets up the focus, key listeners, visual effects, and initializes the BoardRenderer. This method is automatically called after the FXML file has been loaded.

      Specified by:
      initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
      Parameters:
      location - The location used to resolve relative paths for the root object, or null.
      resources - The resources used to localize the root object, or null.

    • handleKeyPressed

      private void handleKeyPressed(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent keyEvent)
      Central handler for keyboard input.

      Maps keys (WASD, Arrows, P, ESC) to specific game events and forwards them to the event listener if the game is running.

      Parameters:
      keyEvent - The key event triggered by the user.

    • initGameView

      public void initGameView(int[][] boardMatrix, ViewData brick)
      Initializes the visual state of the game and starts the game loop.
      Parameters:
      boardMatrix - The initial grid state.
      brick - The initial view data for the active brick.

    • refreshBrick

      private void refreshBrick(ViewData brick)
      Refreshes the rendering of the active brick and next piece preview.
      Parameters:
      brick - The current view data containing brick positions and shapes.

    • refreshGameBackground

      public void refreshGameBackground(int[][] board)
      Refreshes the background grid (locked blocks).
      Parameters:
      board - The 2D array representing the board state.

    • moveDown

      private void moveDown(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a downward movement event (gravity or soft drop).
      Parameters:
      event - The move event details.

    • moveHardDrop

      private void moveHardDrop(MoveEvent event)
      Handles a hard drop event.
      Parameters:
      event - The move event details.

    • setEventListener

      public void setEventListener(InputEventListener eventListener)
      Sets the listener for input events.
      Parameters:
      eventListener - The controller implementing the listener interface.

    • bindGameStats

      public void bindGameStats(javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty scoreProp, javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty levelProp, javafx.beans.property.IntegerProperty linesProp)
      Binds the UI labels to the observable properties in the Score model.

      This ensures the UI automatically updates when the score, level, or lines change. It also attaches a listener to the level property to adjust game speed dynamically.

      Parameters:
      scoreProp - The score property.
      levelProp - The level property.
      linesProp - The lines cleared property.

    • gameOver

      public void gameOver()
      Transitions the game to the Game Over state.

      Stops the timeline and displays the Game Over banner.

    • newGame

      public void newGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Starts a new game session.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggering the new game (can be null).

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      Toggles the game state between Running and Paused.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - The event triggering the pause (can be null).

    • showScoreBonus

      public void showScoreBonus(String text)
      Displays a floating score bonus or notification text.
      Parameters:
      text - The text to display (e.g., "+100" or "LEVEL 2").

    • showHoldPiece

      public void showHoldPiece(int[][] shape)
      Delegates the rendering of the held piece to the BoardRenderer.
      Parameters:
      shape - The shape matrix of the held brick.

    • setHighScore

      public void setHighScore(int score)
      Updates the High Score label text.
      Parameters:
      score - The high score value to display.

    • togglePauseMenu

      public void togglePauseMenu()
      Toggles the in-game pause menu overlay.

      If the game is running, it pauses the timeline and shows the menu. If paused, it resumes the timeline and hides the menu.

    • onResume

      public void onResume(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)
      Handler for the "Resume" button in the pause menu.
      Parameters:
      event - The button click event.

    • onExitToMenu

      public void onExitToMenu(javafx.event.ActionEvent event) throws IOException
      Handler for the "Main Menu" button.

      Stops the game loop and navigates back to the main menu scene.

      Parameters:
      event - The button click event.
      Throws:
      IOException - If the mainMenu.fxml file cannot be loaded.
